newsitem.title: USA: NYMEX Hub natgas ends lower but still in range.
newsitem.headline: NYMEX Hub natgas ends lower but still in range.

text.p: NYMEX Hub gas futures ended mostly lower Tuesday in another sluggish trading session, as April cash and May futures tracked a similar pattern, market sources said.
May finished 4.4 cents lower at $1.882 per mmBtu, while June settled down 2.4 cents at $1.944. Other deferreds were also lower, except in the fall and winter months.

"We're still holding onto that same range. Until cash makes a move, we probably won't see May break out of it," one source said, adding he expected to see some downward pressure on cash once milder weather arrives later this week.

Technically, minor support in May was still pegged at $1.86. Further support was seen at $1.825, $1.78 and the contract low of $1.71. Traders said resistance was still at $1.95-1.97, and then at $2.04-2.05.
NYMEX's 12-month strip dropped 0.8 cent to $2.087 as an estimated 19,656 Hub contracts traded. Open interest for March 31 rose 1,189 to 165,036.

In the cash market, a rally was quelled early by forecasts calling for warmer weather across most of the U.S. this week. Gulf Coast prices were up an average of 10 cents to the mid-$1.90s. Midcontinent prices gained four cents to about $1.75-1.77, while New York city-gate values eased into the high-teens amid a rising thermometer reading.

In Weather Services Corp's six- to 10-day outlook, forecasts area calling for mostly normal temperatures throughout the U.S., with patches of colder weather expected to surface in the central and northern plains. Above-normal temperatures are forecast for most of the East Coast later this week and into next week.
No Permian or Alberta natgas futures traded.
On KCBT, May settled two cents lower at $1.74, while deferreds were flat to one cent lower. The East/West spread narrowed by 2.4 cents to 14.2 cents (NYMEX premium).
Physical prices in the Permian basin were up in the mid-to-high $1.70s, while Waha gas sold in the high-$1.70s to mid-$1.80s.
